resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
jackylee-ch opened a new pull request, #13146:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13146

   We are using Arrow in Spark. When the specification is turned on, it is possible for the task to be forcibly killed during the running process. It means, `JniLoader.get().ensureLoaded()` maybe failed with `ClosedByInterruptException` when the task was killed, and it should be accepted with this.
   However, `NativeMemoryPool` use it as a static code, this leads to an init failure every time the NativeMemroyPool is trying to initialized and can never succeed. It would always fail to init `NativeMemoryPool` with `java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class org.apache.arrow.dataset.jni.NativeMemoryPool`.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13146#issuecomment-1125863142

   Thanks for opening a pull request!
   
   If this is not a [minor PR](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#Minor-Fixes). Could you open an issue for this pull request on JIRA? https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW
   
   Opening JIRAs ahead of time contributes to the [Openness](http://theapacheway.com/open/#:~:text=Openness%20allows%20new%20users%20the,must%20happen%20in%20the%20open.) of the Apache Arrow project.
   
   Then could you also rename pull request title in the following format?
   
       ARROW-${JIRA_ID}: [${COMPONENT}] ${SUMMARY}
   
   or
   
       MINOR: [${COMPONENT}] ${SUMMARY}
   
   See also:
   
     * [Other pull requests](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pulls/)
     * [Contribution Guidelines - How to contribute patches](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/developers/contributing.html#how-to-contribute-patches)

jackylee-ch commented on PR #13146:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13146#issuecomment-1125866760

   > ⚠️ Ticket **has no components in JIRA**, make sure you assign one.
   
   Done

lidavidm commented on PR #13146:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13146#issuecomment-1125993658

   Could you elaborate on 
   > When the specification is turned on
   ?

jackylee-ch commented on PR #13146:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13146#issuecomment-1126006997

   > Could you elaborate on
   > 
   > > When the specification is turned on
   > 
   > ?
   
   Thanks for your attension.
   When spark speculation is turned on, the spark program allows the user's logic to be executed in parelle,  which means there will be two same logic running at the same time. spark will interrupt the unfinished task once one of them finished and then run other tasks. 
   
   Back to current PR, if it is killed when calling `JniLoader.get.ensureLoaded` in NativeMemoryPool initlization, it will cause the `NativeMemoryPool` to never be initialized successfully in the subsequent execution process.

pitrou commented on PR #13146:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13146#issuecomment-1126198583

   cc @lwhite1 , who has started working on various JNI aspects.

jackylee-ch commented on PR #13146:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13146#issuecomment-1148568099

   > @jackylee-ch Would you like to follow up on @lidavidm 's suggestion above?
   
   Sure.

jackylee-ch commented on PR #13146:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13146#issuecomment-1150546543

   Thanks for your help @lidavidm @pitrou

issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: We are using Arrow in Spark. When the specification is turned on, it is possible for the task to be forcibly killed during the running process. It means, `JniLoader.get().ensureLoaded()` maybe failed with `ClosedByInterruptException` when the task was killed. Meanwhile `NativeMemoryPool` use it as a static code, this leads to an init failure every time the NativeMemroyPool is trying to initialized and can never succeed. It would always fail to init `NativeMemoryPool` with `java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class org.apache.arrow.dataset.jni.NativeMemoryPool`
